privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Last updated: February 11, 2026
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how UniSearch processes data locally and keeps your searches private.

introduction.title: Introduction
body: UniSearch is designed around on-device processing.
Most data never leaves your phone.

data.title: Data we process
body: Installed apps, contacts, and files are indexed locally for fast search.
Search history is stored locally to improve ranking.
Settings and customization are stored on-device.

permissions.title: Permissions
body: Contacts, files, photos, and notifications are optional permissions.
If you deny a permission, the related section simply stays disabled.
You can change permissions anytime in Android settings.

analytics.title: Analytics (opt-in)
body: Basic analytics may be offered as an opt-in to improve the app.
We will update this policy before enabling analytics.

ads.title: Ads / sponsored sections
body: The free version may show sponsored sections.
Pro removes sponsored content.

sharing.title: Data sharing
body: We do not sell or share personal data with third parties.
If you use AI prompts, only the prompt text is sent to the selected provider.

security.title: Security
body: All indexed data stays on your device.
We follow best practices to protect local storage.

rights.title: User rights
body: You can delete your local data anytime by clearing the app storage.
You control all permissions and visibility settings.

contact.title: Contact
body: If you have questions about privacy, contact us via email.
